#summary This tutorial will explain how to use RDFonthego.

= Introduction =

 RDF Onthego is project to build RDF store and query processor on Android phone.
 For more information: <a href='http://iswc2010.semanticweb.org/pdf/503.pdf'>RDF On the Go</a>

=1. Setup project:=
==Step 1:<a href='http://developer.android.com==/sdk/installing.html'>Create a Android project.</a>
 RDFOnthego requires Android 2.1 or later version. And don't forget to add WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission to your project.
Step 2: Adding rdfonthego external jar file to your Android project
  RDFOnthego uses Berkeley DB for storing RDF data
  
  - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/je-android-4.1.10.jar'>Berkeley JE for Android.</a>  (Required!)
 
 Jena and ARQ Semantic Web Toolkit built for Android RDF Store
 
 - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/deri.org.rdfonthego.iri.jar'>The Jena IRI Library.</a> (Required!)
 
 - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/deri.org.rdfonthego.core.jar'>RDF Store Engine.</a>  (Required!)
  
 Spatial packages if you want to work with Geo data
 
 - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/deri.org.rdfonthego.arq.jar'>SPARQL Engine.</a> (Optional!)
 
 - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/deri.org.rdfonthego.spatial.jar'>Spatial Engine.</a> (Optional!)
  
 And Lucene package
 
 - <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/lucene-core-2.3.1.jar'>Lucene package</a> and <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/deri.org.rdfonthego.lucene.jar'>Lucene Jena</a> (Optional!)

 
= 2. Working with RDFOnthego =
  
 RDFOnthego based on <a href='http://jena.sourceforge.net/'>Jena Semantic Web</a> framework, so that it works like Jena. You can take a look at <a href = 'http://jena.sourceforge.net/tutorial/RDF_API/index.html'> Jena Tutorial </a> for .
